intro: Alyxia spathulata, commonly known as the broad-leaf alyxia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, fragrant, white to pinkish flowers. It typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and can reach heights of up to 2 meters. Alyxia spathulata is often found in the understory of forests and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role.
